comments.body:
There is no post method for creating a new DAG run and thus triggering a DAG as the experimental API has done for a few years.

Also it would be useful if there were some parameters to limit the scope of returned DAG runs, especially if we keep the id as the way to act on DAG runs, since this call will be the only way to find the right id number.
E.G. run_id_prefix and/or execution_date_range_start and execution_date_range_end could be query string parameters.

Good point. I created new endpoint that allows us to trigger a DAG.
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/8721/commits/00af37766eb6bd72dfc5c4f1c772369e31a29582

I've also added filters for GET /dagRuns.
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/8721/commits/d922f2b67a3d759169a21ac1ed4bb396c227ac7f

However, I'm afraid it's safe to add run_id_prefix. This can cause inefficient queries. I think that we should include filtering if there is an established need to do so. It is always possible to add filtering later, but removing it is a breaking change. This is currently necessary in some cases, but I think we will be able to eliminate it soon.
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/8227

comments.body: I had never noticed that dag runs had an id in addition to their dag id, run id and execution date unique paired constraints. I don't think that users will expect to be using the id number to refer to dag runs.

comments.body:
This path would only work if we are okay with using the dag run's id column here.

Since dag_id and execution_date and dag_id and run_id are pairs of unique constraints as a user who's never seen the id used before, I'd expect something like `/dags/{dag_id}/dagRuns/{run_id}` or `/dags/{dag_id}/dagRuns/{execution_date}`

I updated spec. Now we use execution_date. 
Here is commit: 
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/8721/commits/3d014d69fa6518fa4d6a124d0b8f94758cea994e

comments.body:
On the topic of updating a task instance, I'd like to see an api for the equivalent of the cli and ui "clear task" operation.
The reason this shouldn't be left to CRUD operations, is that even for just one TI it needs to set running states to shutdown, and related jobs to shutdown OR set other states to none, and then set the DAG run for this task instance change to running. Also it would be a convenience if it could clear downstream and or upstream tasks too. Then there's special handling for subdag's inner tasks.
If we only provide CRUD operations most users aren't going to implement all the right steps for clearing and rerunning a set of tasks.
Good point. I will add endpoint.
I created a new endpoint: https://github.com/apache/airflow/commit/6514d68ee8eb86fd28b7a9bebc64d2089f6f9ef3
